intro: Tritomodon japonicus, commonly known as the Japanese tritomodon, is a rare flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky crevices. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
